intro: Leiothrix distichoclada var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular leiothrix, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The leaves are usually opposite and may have glandular structures, giving the plant its specific variety name. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical environments. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
